newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia signs DM 200 mln two-year syndicated loan.
newsitem.headline: Croatia signs DM 200 mln two-year syndicated loan.

text.p: Croatia signed an agreement on Thursday with some 30 foreign commercial creditor banks for its first 200 million German marks syndicated loan.
The loan, repayable in total in two years, was granted at 1.75 percentage points above Libor, government officials and representatives of the arranger Dresdner Bank told reporters.
They said the syndication was substantially oversubscribed, allowing Croatia to raise the target for the borrowing from the original 150 million marks.

This was Croatia's sovereign debut on the international capital market after it reached a rescheduling deal with the London Club of commercial creditors for a 29.5 percent share of the former Yugoslav debt earlier this year. -- Kolumbina Bencevic, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
